response:
Summary:

Patient presents with irregular menstrual cycles, intense cramps, and heavier flow, raising concerns for underlying conditions. (GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain)

Body:

Patient reports irregular menstrual cycles, increased cramps, and heavier flow. (GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain)

No history of ovarian cysts or endometriosis. (GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain)

Further investigation with pelvic exam and imaging studies is warranted. A family history of endometriosis would make the diagnosis more likely (Endometriosis: diagnosis and management NICE guideline)

Plan:

  1. Further evaluation with ultrasound to confirm fibroids. (Uptodate - 2025 - Uterine fibroids (leiomyomas) Treatment overview - UpToDate)
  2. Consider medication for bleeding control or myomectomy for severe cases. (Uptodate - 2025 - Uterine fibroids (leiomyomas) Treatment overview - UpToDate)
  3. Address PCOS for menstrual cycle regulation. (GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain)
  4. Referral to gynecologist for comprehensive management. (GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain)
